nl.strohalm.cyclos.entities.accounts
Enum LockedAccountsOnPayments

java.lang.Object

      nl.strohalm.cyclos.entities.accounts.LockedAccountsOnPayments
All Implemented Interfaces:

public enum LockedAccountsOnPayments
extends java.lang.Enum<LockedAccountsOnPayments>

Determines which accounts are locked in payments

Author:
luis

Enum Constant Summary
ALL
          Locks all involved accounts, even on fees.
NONE
          No accounts are locked.
ORIGIN

Enum Constant Detail

NONE

public static final LockedAccountsOnPayments NONE
No accounts are locked. Uses a single DB transaction on payments. Concurrent payments from / to the same account might allow an account to go beyond it's lower / upper limit. However, if used in conjunction with not letting the same user have multiple logins largely reduces this possibility. Also, by not having a separated DB transaction, is the only method supported in Cyclos standalone, which uses HSQLDB (which only allows a single DB connection)

ORIGIN

public static final LockedAccountsOnPayments ORIGIN
Only the origin account of the main transfer is locked. Will never allow it to go beyond the lower limit, but might allow the receiver account to go beyond the upper limit. Uses a separated DB transaction for the payment.

ALL

public static final LockedAccountsOnPayments ALL
Locks all involved accounts, even on fees. Absolutely guarantees that no account will ever go beyond any of it's limits (lower / upper). However, might cause a big performance impact in very active systems. Uses a separated DB transaction for the payment.
